 24 -class SensorDataCapture(object): 

 25      """ 
 26      Sensor data captured synchronously from one or more devices. 
 27      """ 
 28   

 29 -    def __init__(self): 

 30          """ 
 31          Initialise capture. 
 32          """ 
 33          self._devices = dict() 

 34   

 35 -    def _addDevice(self, id, unit): 

 36          self._devices[id] = unit 

 37   
 38      @staticmethod 

 39 -    def load(filename): 

 40          """ 
 41          Load a capture from a file. 
 42   
 43          @param filename: Name of file to load from. 
 44          @return: A L{SensorDataCapture} object. 
 45          """ 
 46          capture = cPickle.load(open(filename)) 
 47          assert isinstance(capture, SensorDataCapture), \ 
 48                  "File did not contain a SensorDataCapture" 
 49          return capture 

 50   

 51 -    def save(self,filename): 

 52          """ 
 53          Save this capture to a file. 
 54   
 55          @param filename: Name of file to save to. 
 56          """ 
 57          cPickle.dump(self, open(filename,'w'))

 59      @property 

 60 -    def devices(self): 

 61          """ 
 62          List of the devices in this capture. 
 63          """ 
 64          return self._devices.values() 

 65   

 66 -    def device(self, id): 

 67          """ 
 68          Get a device from the capture by identifier. 
 69   
 70          @return: A L{CapturedDevice} object. 
 71          """ 
 72          return self._devices[id]

 74 -class CapturedDevice(object): 

 75      """ 
 76      A device with one or more colocated sensors from which data was captured. 
 77      """ 

 78 -    def __init__(self, capture, id): 

 79          """ 
 80          Initialise captured device. 
 81   
 82          @param capture: Parent L{SensorDataCapture}. 
 83          @param id: Device identifier. 
 84          """ 
 85          self.capture = capture 
 86          self.id = id 
 87          self.capture._addDevice(id, self) 
 88          self._sensorData = {} 

 89   

 90 -    def addSensorData(self, id, data): 

 91          """ 
 92          Add data for a sensor on this device. 
 93   
 94          @param id: Identifier for this sensor. 
 95          @param data: L{TimeSeries} of sensor data. 
 96          """ 
 97          self._sensorData[id] = data 

 98   
 99      @property 

100 -    def sensors(self): 

101          """ 
102          List of the sensor identifiers on this sensor unit. 
103          """ 
104          return self._sensorData.keys() 

105   

106 -    def sensorData(self, id): 

107          """ 
108          Get data for a given sensor identifier. 
109   
110          @return: A L{TimeSeries} containing data for this sensor. 
111          """ 
112          return self._sensorData[id]
